3: Thank you for speaking up for me last time, Commandant.

2: I wasn't really able to do anything.
4: Don't you mind being called a fence sitter?

3: It is true that I'm neither here nor there, isn't it? Not to mention that there's only so much one person can do. That wasn't your fight, Commandant.
I can't keep my role as a Purifying Force member away when I'm on the Gray Raven Task Force.
And I can't tackle my missions like a proper Purifying Force member when I'm there.
From what I can tell, I do seem to be sitting on the fence, don't I?

2: You're a remarkable member of my squad.
4: But you managed to help a lot of people that way.

3: Do you mean the people from the Support Force?
I didn't think they would thank me.
I wasn't forced into the Purifying Force because of my model, Commandant.
As I've told you, I don't intend to let the Purifying Force become a mindless coalition of butchers.
That's why I've worked so hard to reach the position of leadership to make sure I know the story behind every case.
Even if I got called a fence sitter... I will still abide by my belief until the very end.
Just like what you did with me.
...The constant gifts and the little acts of intimacy, of course. Have you forgotten already, or have you...
Either way, you surely are fearless, Commandant.
